text.0: neer is he injured whom the gods varuṇa mitra aryaman.
text.2: he prospers ever free from scathe whom they as with full hands enrich.
text.3: whom they preserve from every foe.
text.4: the kings drive far away from him his troubles and his enemies.
text.5: and lead him safely oer distress.
text.6: thornless Ādityas is the path easy for him who seeks the law.
text.7: with him is naught to anger you.
text.8: what sacrifice Ādityas ye heroes guide by the path direct.
text.9: may that come nigh unto your thought.
text.10: that mortal ever unsubdued gains wealth and every precious thing.
text.11: and children also of his own.
text.12: how my friends shall we prepare aryamans and mitras laud.
text.14: i point not out to you a man who strikes the pious or reviles.
text.15: only with hymns i call you nigh.
text.16: let him not love to speak ill words but fear the one who holds all four.
text.17: within his hand until they fall.
